Hexxagon.Model

Interface IGamePlay

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GamePlay

    public interface IGamePlay
extends Serializable
    Contains method specifications of data component of Hexxagon module.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Sandor Kalmanchey

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IGamePlay.StatusCode
      Stores statuses of actual game play.

      Stores maximum player index allowed.

      It stores the highest index allowed of column.

      It stores the highest index allowed of row.

    • Method Detail

      • testAndThrowIfStandsInvalid

        void testAndThrowIfStandsInvalid(byte[][] stands)
                          throws TError
        An input testing method invocate from other methods. It determines whether the input is correct or not. In case of invalid input TError is thrown.
        Parameters:
        stands - The board array to test.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if the board array is invalid.

      • setGamePlayStatus

        void setGamePlayStatus(IGamePlay.StatusCode newStatus)
        Sets the status of the game.
        Parameters:
        newStatus - The status enum to be set.

      • getStatus

        IGamePlay.StatusCode getStatus()
        Retrieves the game status.
        Returns:
        A StatusCode enum.

      • isPlayerExists

        boolean isPlayerExists(byte playerIndex)
        Tells whether the specified player exists.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The unique player index of the player.
        Returns:
        True if the specified player exists, false otherwise.

      • addPlayer

        void addPlayer(IPlayer player,
               byte playerIndex)
        throws TError
        Adds a player to the game play.
        Parameters:
        player - The player object.
        playerIndex - The unique index of the player.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • getStands

        byte[][] getStands()
        Retrieves the positions of players. By other words: It shows the shape of the board.
        Returns:
        A two dimensional byte array.

      • setBoard

        void setBoard(byte[][] stands)
       throws TError
        Sets the positions of the players. By other words: It shows the shape of the board.
        Parameters:
        stands - A two dimensional byte array.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

        Parameters:

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished()
        Tells whether the game is finished.
        Returns:
        True if game is finished, false otherwise.
